The Iraq War

The events and effects of US involvement in War on Terror

March 20, 2003

President Bush announces U.S forces have begun a military operation into Iraq.

April 9, 2003

Saddam Hussein's rule collapses in a matter of hours as much of Baghdad comes under American control. Three weeks after the invasion, Iraqi civilians and U.S. soldiers topple over statue of Saddam in Baghdad's Firdos Square

May 1, 2003

Speaking from the deck of the aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln, President Bush declares the topple of Saddam Hussein's government as one victory in a war on terror. He vows to continue to search for banned weapons in Iraq, a search that so far has been largely unsuccessful.

December 13 2003

Saddam Hussein is found by U.S. troops in an eight foot-holr near Tikrit by U.S.

December 30, 2006

After facing two trials, Mr. Hussein is executed in while clutching a Quran. This did nothing to end the continuing violence across Iraq however. By this point, the list of American military deaths reaches at least 3,000 since the March 2003 invasion. A month latar, Bush vows to commit an additional twenty thousand troops to bring stability in and around Baghdad

November 4, 2008

Obama campaigns on a vow to withdraw combat troops in Iraq. The weeks later the Iraqi Parliament approves a pair of agreements to withdraw U.S. forces by 2011.

June 2009

U.S. combat troops withdraw from Baghdad and other Iraqi cities in accordance with SOFA. The withdrawal was controversial, with Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki declaring the great victory a national holiday while some civilians and U.S. military officers expressed concerns about Iraqi forces' capabilities.

March 7, 2010

Defying dozens of explosions throughout Baghdad and other Iraqi cities, Iraqis go to the polls in strength to choose a new Parliament, an important step toward withdrawing U.S. troops in the summer of 2010

August 31, 2010

President Obama declared an end to the seven-year American combat mission in Iraq, saying that the US has met its responsibility to that country and that it is now time to turn to pressing problems at home.

October 21, 2011

President Obama announces that the last American soldier will leave Iraq by the end of the year. The nine-year militray engagement that cost the lives of 4,400 tropps and more than $1 trillion while also defining America's role in the world.

2011

Total number of Iraqis who died of violence from 2003-2011 is between 150,000 to 400, 000. The number of United States troops who have died fighting the wars in Iraq have passed 7,000. An additional 30,177 suicides among U.S. service members & veterans of the post 9/11 wars. The American public still for the most part has no idea what the United States did while in the Middle East. It is important to reflect on war and distruction of the 8 year, 8 month war.

Source/Kaynak
